RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em International Relations - Institut d'tudes Politiques de Paris (1987) e doutorado em Cincia Sociais e Poltica - European University Institute (1997). Atualmente professora da Pontifcia Universidade Catlica do Rio de Janeiro, professora - Copenhagen Business School, team member - Copenhagen Business School e professora - The Graduate Institute. Tem experincia na rea de Cincia Poltica, com nfase em Poltica Internacional, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: security, united nations (un), information society, technology e global finance. Em 2019 ganhou o prmio "STAIR Distinguished Scholar Award" da International Studies Association.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at International Relations from Institut d'tudes Politiques de Paris (1987) and doctorate at Cincia Sociais e Poltica from European University Institute (1997). He is currently professor at Copenhagen Business School and team member at Copenhagen Business School. Has experience in Political Science, focusing on International Politics, acting on the following subjects: security, united nations (un), information society, technology and global finance.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: International Law Between Constitutionalisation and Fragmentation: the role of law in the post-national constellation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: International law faces several structural changes: from the advent of asymmetric wars, the war on terror, the resurrection of targeted killings, piracy to the degradation of the global environment or the challenges posed by the global economic crisis. These challenges escape the constitutive confines of the state system and require new answers. The current literature treats fragmentation, politicization and constitutionalisation as separate or opposite trends in the international legal order. This Action takes as a vantage point that they have to be thought together as dimensions of a more fundamental systemic change. This Action therefore brings together scholars from a variety of disciplines to analyze this complex relationship and assess the changing structure of the legal system.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: International law faces several structural changes: from the advent of asymmetric wars, the war on terror, the resurrection of targeted killings, piracy to the degradation of the global environment or the challenges posed by the global economic crisis. These challenges escape the constitutive confines of the state system and require new answers. The current literature treats fragmentation, politicization and constitutionalisation as separate or opposite trends in the international legal order. This Action takes as a vantage point that they have to be thought together as dimensions of a more fundamental systemic change. This Action therefore brings together scholars from a variety of disciplines to analyze this complex relationship and assess the changing structure of the legal system.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: International Law Between Constitutionalisation and Fragmentation: the role of law in the post-national constellation

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The primary objective of the Action is to increase and deepen knowledge about living and working in the surveillance age, in order to better understand the consequences and impacts of enhanced surveillance, and subsequently to make recommendations about its future governance and practice.
